data.title: The rum punch- wow.
data.text:
The first time I came here, I was on a date. I knew nothing about this place- at all. I was also skeptical because it had a nice lounge/bar vibe and pairing that with West Indian food is usually not a good outcome. 

The food is fantastic. Even the OXTAIL!!! I think I have gone back enough times to have tasted most of the menu. It's worth it. Some days they close early but I believe they are closed on Mondays but it's worth the trip. Don't forget the carafe of rum punch. You must buy a carafe- you're cheating yourself if you buy it by the glass.

data.title: A great spot for happy hour and dinner
data.text: The atmosphere here is fun, friendly and the food is quite good.  Try the rum punch, jerk chicken and oxtails.  They also had a DJ.  The space is tight for a DJ, but the music is good.  They are much more than you would think from looking at the outside.

data.title: "THE PLACE TO GO"
data.text:
"A picture says a thousand words" 
Discovered this place on a visit to New Rochelle Octoberof 2015, and just wanted to eat to eat my plate as well.
Then in July of 2016 was visiting New York, with my daughter and just had to let her expérience it as well.
This is the "CAN-EH-DIAN WEH

data.title: Nice Fusion Cuisine
data.text: The restaurant is small, but comfortable. The staff is friendly and accommodating. We were a party of three and the place was packed. No problem. They seated us at the bar and we had  full dinners with appetizers and drinks. They make a great non alcoholic fruit punch and a fantastic rum punch. The curried lobster is fabulous, the calamari is great and the salad is crisp and fresh. we will go back and take our friends.

data.title: Excellent  food and service
data.text: Service is friendly . The food was very good. I highly recommend the rasta pasta. Very chic decor. Lively bar atmosphere . Strong drinks. Great for a night out with friends or a date. I definitely recommend.  Be sure to make a reservation as it is a small restaurant and very popular.  The kitchen is small. Bring your patience as there will be a long wait for food. It's worth the wait. The coconut cake is a MUST!

data.title: Loved it!
data.text: Had sweet potato fries (dramatically better than any sweet potato fries I've ever tried) and baked mac & cheese, both were excellent, very friendly service and excellent drinks!

data.title: "I must return on my next visit to New York"
data.text: The place was so packed that we were unable to be seated at a table to have our late night supper.   We were lucky to get a seat at the bar, which was just as fine. otherwise it would have been a 2 hour wait time. had the best Mojito ever!  As for the food and service, top of the line.👍🏿👍🏿👍🏿👍🏿🍻

data.title: No second visit for me
data.text:
I have heard the reviews, and heard the raves from friends of friends, so I was really excited about trying this place.
A few friends and I visited last Friday night and after a 1 1/2 hr wait for dinner ( which I honestly didn't mind) as we got the chance to sit by the bar and catch up with drinks and appetizers which was really good, we moved to the dining room as the band was really getting into action! I thoroughly enjoyed the music. Very nice!
However, it took an exceptionally long time  for our waiter to show up, and when he did, it was not a pleasant "hello",but more like we were another bother. I was shocked by his attitude and remained unimpressed throughout the night. When he finally got our food to us, he literally put the food on the table and pushed it across to whomever, and I mean whomever it landed in front of. That in itself was just inappropriate. My mouth dropped open throughout the night by his behavior, including the fact that there was another table across from us with a few young ladies whom he seemed to have taken a liking to, and I think at that time everyone else just became an imposition, because that's where he wanted to be and spent his entire time there. I think his shift should have ended then. It took us a very long time to get his attention, our check, to get his attention to order our last round of drinks. The entire dining experience was like pulling teeth, and unlike anything I had experienced in any other dining establishment. The food was also average, in my opinion and the waiter never bothered to give us water, and it was impossible to get his attention.
When I ordered the last round of drinks. He took the order, went back to the ladies, then after a while he took the order to the bar, went back to the ladies and we had to remind him to get our drinks. After he finally did . He left the check on the table and I just took it to the bar to take care of it myself, instead of bothering him. 
I have to commend the hostesses who did an amazing job every time we encountered with them. They were pleasant, professional and very accommodating. 
I will definitely not return. I consider the food average and would have probably given it a second shot if our waiter had done a better job.

data.title: family get together
data.text: food was exquisite! great atmosphere and staff, parking is good no hassle there, well accomodating staff, food a bit pricey but well worth it!

data.title: Excellent departure from the typical
data.text: I was in town for business and found this nice little Caribbean food joint around the corner from my hotel, right downtown. The jerk chicken was flavorful, moist, and served with a nice sauce with a kick along with jasmine rice. The jerk rub was delicious and the portions were more than enough for one. I couldn't even finish everything. Good service also with really friendly staff. Stacy was pleasant and very helpful.

data.title: Food is inconsistent but the vibes are good
data.text: i started going here when it opened and loved everything about it. However, since it's gained popularity the food to me is not as good as it once was. The atmosphere however is good and the drinks are potent. On Fridays they have a live band and that's always an enjoyable time.

data.title: Great after work and dinner spot
data.text: A Place. 2 Go is a great place to go after work or for dinner. Convivial bar with great drinks and Caribbean food. A much needed tablecloth Caribbean restaurant with live music some nights.

data.title: Excellent food, fair service
data.text: My husband and I dined here and really enjoyed the food.  He had the jerk chicken and raved about it.  I had the oxtail which was slow cooked with a great dark sauce.  The service was inattentive and unresponsive, which is why I gave it 3 stars instead of 4.

data.title: Fun place -- fun food - great service
data.text: Love Caribbean food so went with hubby and another like mixed couple. Great food --many dishes are spicy but were very good if you like the spice! Friend had oxtail (yes.. oxtail) and he said it was great. I had jerk chicken which I love-- very spicy - good quality chicken, moist and delish. Husband had a spice shrimp dish- also amazing.... waitress was fun and knowledgable about the spice level -- owner came over to chat for a bit-- she is from the Bahamas and husband who is the chef is from Jamaica--- Great decor -- they even have reggae music on Friday nights.... go and have a great time!

data.title: Wonderful treat!
data.text: In New Rochelle on business, had a GREAT meal here. Decor and service are terrific, too. Don't miss the black cake!

data.title: Good Quick Meal...
data.text: Went on a Saturday late afternoon (4PM).  The food was good, wasn't great because I was a little disappointed with the Rice & Peas.  The rice smelled and tasted like Jasmine rice, which is not what Jamaican Rice & Peas are made with, so it lost a few points with that.  The jerk chicken, which is what I ordered was definitely on the spicier side... but it's jerk, so that's to be expected.  I also had a rum punch, could have used a little more rum and less punch.... but overall, it was a good meal and the place is inviting.  FYI - the bathroom are super small... be prepared to squeeze into one of the small cramped stalls (for an average size person).

data.title: FANTASTIC and DELICIOUS!!!
data.text: Walk Don't Run...this is a place 2 go!  The food is amazingly delicious and the waitstaff, owner/chef and his wife are so pleasant. This is truly what customer service is all about!!!  Well Done!! My husband and I Love the food here, and, the drinks!  I had the Rum Punch and my husband had the Long Island Iced Tea - WOWEEE!  We had the Shrimp with bonnet peppers, jerk chicken, jerk pork and vegetarian fried rice along with the mixed vegetables.  I don't think my husband and I spoke about anything else during dinner, but, the food!  It is fresh, well seasoned, spicy and just plain Delicious!  We hope they will have room for us again this Saturday evening!  We cant wait to go, it was that GREAT!!!

data.title: The place to Be
data.text: The food is delicious and so are the drinks. Try the oxtail and the rum punch. Can you say YUM! The atmosphere is great! I highly recommend.

data.title: A GREAT place to go!
data.text: Coming from Rockland County I wanted to take my boyfriend out for his birthday but not the same old TGIF place so a friend suggested A PLACE TO GO .... Not to far with that carribean vibe....the live band wow and the food was great the decor well let me say they out did them selves inspite the place being BUSY all night the service was great along with the smiles on their faces.

data.title: Tight space, but delicious food
data.text:
My party of 10 (one baby, two tweens, seven adults) came to A Place 2 Go to celebrate Mother's Day.  Several tables were put together in the middle of the restaurant to accommodate our large group.  It was a bit tight because the place was filled with patrons, and we were bumped into here and there, but we were still able to sit comfortably.  Booth seating was also available.

The food and service were a hit despite the heavy crowd.  Our waiter was very pleasant and he checked in on us often.  We ordered mixed drinks, appetizers and entrees which all appeared in a decent amount of time.  My favorites were the coconut shrimp appetizer and the jerk chicken.  The shrimp was succulent and crunchy, while the jerk chicken was subtly sweet and aromatic.  It was the best jerk chicken I've ever had and I eat a lot of jerk chicken!  I chose to have rice and peas with my chicken, but white rice was also an option.  The portions were very generous although I wished I could eat more.  The rest of my table seemed to enjoy their meals - all cleared plates!  Our table mostly ordered oxtail which was very tasty.  Kid friendly items were on the menu like chicken fingers and mac and cheese.  

A very friendly gentleman walked around taking pictures possibly for their website.  He gladly offered to email photos to patrons who wanted copies.  

This is a restaurant worth visiting again.  The food was very good and the atmosphere was quite festive.  There was a bar near the front of the restaurant which doled out tasty drinks.  In general, the staff was way above par and accommodating.  I would recommend this place for any occasion.
